titlestmt.titleproper: Emington, Ill. Emington Congregational Church records, 1875-2021.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday November 26, 2024 at 20:45

did.unittitle: Emington, Ill. Emington Congregational Church records, 1875-2021.
did.abstract: The Emington Congregational Church in Emington, Illinois, was established on March 23, 1875. The church building was moved from farmland to the center of Emington in 1881. A new church was built on the same location between 1905 and 1906 to accommodate the growing congregation. The church shared ministry with the Dwight Congregational Church briefly in 1931 and more permanently with the Odell Congregational Church starting in 1955. The church joined the United Church of Christ in 1964 and closed in 2021. This archival collection contains records which document the operation of the church as well as records which document the activities of the members of the church. The collection includes meeting minutes, auxiliary group records, financial records, and vital membership records.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Emington, Ill. Emington Congregational Church records, 1875-2021, RG5433. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Emington Congregational Church in March 2022; 2022-06.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, November 2024, using Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Emington Congregational Church was established on March 23, 1875, though some of the the initial members of the church had been worshipping together since at least 1868. The original church building had been an unused church at Cedar Point. The building was disassembled and then reassembled at a farm outside Emington. In 1881 the building was moved once again into the center of Emington where the Emington Congregational Church would remain until its eventual closure.

By 1905, the church community had outgrown their edifice and decided to build a new building. Construction began in 1905 and was completed in 1906. A fire damaged part of the roof of the church in 1927. A parsonage was built on the church's land in 1929. The Emington Congregational Church temporarily shared a minister with the Dwight Congregational Church starting in 1931. A more permanent shared ministry with the Odell Congregational Church was begun in 1955 with Rev. Esra Vornholt serving as pastor of both churches. The church joined the United Church of Christ on January 28, 1964. The church closed in 2021.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Emington Congregational Church in Emington, Illinois and includes records which document the operation of the church as well as records which document the activities of the members of the church. The records include meeting minutes, financial records, building records, annual reports, and various versions of the church's by-laws and constitutions. The collection has extensive records relating to the church's Sunday School as well as the church's Ladies Aid Society. In addition to these two groups, the collection contains records for various church auxiliary groups. The records also include membership records and lists, baptismal records, photographs of the church building, people, and events, guest books, and member memorials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into the five series listed below. Within each series, materials have been arranged into chronological order by start date.
Series 4: Programs and auxiliary group records, 1903-2015

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: The First 100 Years: Emington Congregational Church (United Church of Christ) of Emington, Illinois. 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the administration and operation of the Emington Congregational Church. The records include church meeting minutes, annual reports, board of trustees minutes, financial records, pastoral reports and communications, correspondence, constitutions and by-laws, and yearbook reports.

did.unittitle: Esra R. Vornholt communications and reports

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Loose materials were removed from this volume and placed into the folder labeled "Board of trustees records, 1973-1975" to assist in the preservation of those materials.

did.unittitle: Board of deacons and deaconesses records

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: These loose materials were removed from the "Board of trustees records, 1969-1974" for preservation purposes.

did.unittitle: Constitution, by-laws, and statement of faith

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains vital membership records and records related to the general activities of members of the Emington Congregational Church. The records include birth and baptismal records, family records, membership records and lists, newspaper clippings, remembrances and memorials, and photographic materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the Sunday School at the Emington Congregational Church. The records include teacher's records, attendance records, and meeting minutes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the Ladies aid society of the Emington Congregational Church. The records include the meeting minutes for the auxiliary group as well as financial records, correspondence, and an early copy of the group's by-laws.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Loose materials were removed from this volume and placed into the folder labeled "Ladies aid society by-laws, 1914" to assist in the preservation of those materials.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: These loose materials were removed from the "Ladies aid society records, 1902-1910" for preservation purposes.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: These loose materials were removed from the "Ladies aid society records, 1954-1958" for preservation purposes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to various auxiliary groups at the Emington Congregational Church as well as programs and events held by the church. The records include Christian Endeavor records, Little Six Pilgrim League records, Study guild minutes, Pilgrim fellowship records, Men's fellowship records, Memorial and Historical committee records, a book related to the mother-daughter banquet held at the church, records and programs related to church anniversaries, Happy hour study group records, and Friendship circle records.

did.unittitle: The Little Six Pilgrim League records

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: A 1974 letter was removed from the very front of the "Memorial committee records, 1974-1983" volume and placed into this folder for preservation purposes.
